datafield.subfield: The Alabama State Planning Commission (created in 1935) was replaced in 1943 by the State Planning Board. In 1969 the State Planning and Industrial Development Board (which had replaced the State Planning Board in 1955) and the Alabama Program Development Office merged to form the Alabama Development Office.
Works by these agencies are found under the following headings according to the name used at the time of publication:
Alabama. State Planning and Industrial Development Board.

SUBJECT ENTRY: Works about these bodies are entered under the name resulting from the merger. Works limited in subject coverage to the pre-merger period are entered under the name of one or more of the original bodies. In the case of change of name entry is made under the name used during the latest period covered.
(Alabama Program Development Office; in 1969, merged with Alabama State Planning and Industrial Development Board to form Alabama Development Office)
